snippet: The justices seemed to be leaning toward setting a higher bar for groups of investors to pursue claims they were misled.
abstract: Supreme Court seems ready to impose new limits on securities fraud suits that would make it harder for investors to band together to pursue claims they were misled when they bought or sold securities; justices do not seem inclined, however, to issue ruling that would put end to most such suits.
lead_paragraph: The justices seemed to be leaning toward setting a higher bar for groups of investors to pursue claims they were misled.

headline.main: Justices May Limit Securities Fraud Suits
headline.print_headline: Justices May Limit Securities Fraud Suits
